title: Shiny App Essay
text:
Introduction to Shiny Apps
Shiny is an R package that allows you to build interactive web applications directly from R.
It enables users to manipulate data inputs and instantly see the outputs without having to know any R code themselves.



Key Features of Shiny

Reactive programming: Outputs update instantly when inputs change.
Custom layouts: Apps can be customized with user inputs, tabs, plots, and tables.
Extendable: You can integrate HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for advanced designs.




Example Use Cases

Data dashboards
Real-time financial monitoring
Predictive modeling tools




Why Shiny is Useful
Shiny makes it easy for non-technical users to interact with complex data models.
It bridges the gap between data science and decision-making, by making data accessible, visual, and actionable.

title: Knight Cap: Branding From Concept to Reality
text: Knight Cap came to us in the early stages of their journey, with a vision but no clear direction. Our job? Crafting a cohesive identity that could live across their restaurant, merchandise, and digital presence.

title: Knight Cap: Branding From Concept to Reality
text:
Overview
Knight Cap is more than a name—it’s now a fully realized experience, carefully crafted from concept to execution.

title: Knight Cap: Branding From Concept to Reality
text:
Our Approach

Logo Development – We collaborated with the team to create a bold, recognizable logo that reflects the brand’s personality and fits seamlessly into the restaurant’s atmosphere.

Merchandise That Resonates – Beyond aesthetics, we designed wearable, high-quality merchandise that felt on-brand and desirable for their audience.

Full Branding Execution – From merchandise designs to in-store graphics, we ensured every touchpoint within the restaurant carried the same strong visual identity.

title: Knight Cap: Branding From Concept to Reality
text:
Results

Complete visual identity from logo to merch

Brand cohesion across physical and digital spaces

Merchandise that aligns with Knight Cap’s culture and customer experience

← Back to Portfolio

title: NOJUNK: Niche-Driven Brand Strategy for Maximum Loyalty
text:
With NOJUNK, the goal was simple: turn followers into repeat customers by mastering their niche.
Rooted in lifestyle and motorsports culture, we crafted a brand experience that spoke directly to the right audience with the right messaging.

title: NOJUNK: Niche-Driven Brand Strategy for Maximum Loyalty
text:
Overview
By keeping every move intentional and community-driven, NOJUNK has become more than just a brand—it’s a lifestyle.

title: NOJUNK: Niche-Driven Brand Strategy for Maximum Loyalty
text:
Our Approach

Deep Niche Research – Understanding the motorsports and lifestyle scene allowed us to craft designs and messaging that felt authentic, not forced.

Community Engagement & Exclusivity – By leveraging social trust and organic hype, we positioned NOJUNK as the go-to brand for diehard fans.

Retention-Focused Marketing – Targeted remarketing strategies and exclusive drops kept customers coming back for more, creating a cult-like loyalty around the brand.

title: NOJUNK: Niche-Driven Brand Strategy for Maximum Loyalty
text:
Results

High customer retention with exclusive drops

Strong community-led brand perception

Growth through word-of-mouth and remarketing

← Back to Portfolio

title: Shinylive Essay
text:
Introduction to Shinylive
Shinylive is a new technology that allows you to run Shiny applications directly in a user’s web browser — without needing a backend server.
It packages your Shiny app to run entirely client-side, using WebAssembly.



How Shinylive Differs from Traditional Shiny



Feature
Traditional Shiny
Shinylive




Requires Server
Yes
No


Setup Complexity
Medium-High
Low


Speed
Depends on server
Instant in browser


Offline Access
No
Possible






Pros and Cons of Shinylive
Pros: - No need to maintain a server - Instant load times - Lower deployment costs - Easier to share apps
Cons: - Limited to apps that don’t require heavy computation or real-time server calls - May have browser performance limitations for very large datasets



Why Shinylive is Exciting
Shinylive opens up Shiny development to a wider audience by removing technical and financial barriers, while making deployment faster and easier.

title: Dashboard
text:
Hi! Welcome to the data dashboard. Below are curated insights from the mtcars dataset.




library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(knitr)

mtcars %>%
  select(mpg, cyl, hp, wt) %>%
  head(10) %>%
  kable()

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = hp)) +
  geom_point(color = "steelblue", size = 3) +
  labs(
    title = "Horsepower vs. Weight",
    x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
    y = "Horsepower"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

title: Joshua Arias | Digital Creator & Brand Builder
text:
I’m Joshua Arias, a digital marketer, creative strategist, and entrepreneur based in Los Angeles.
I’m passionate about building brands that move culture — blending streetwear, marketing, and digital innovation into everything I do.
Currently finishing my Master’s in Digital Marketing at Cal Poly Pomona, while scaling multiple apparel brands and growing a creative consulting firm.
This site showcases a few of the tools and frameworks I use to bring ideas to life — built with Quarto, R, and a whole lot of caffeine.





Brand Development & Strategy
Digital Advertising (Meta, Google)
Data Visualization & Analytics
E-commerce Growth (Shopify, Amazon)
Creative Direction & Merchandising






M.S. Digital Marketing, Cal Poly Pomona (Expected 2025)
B.S. Apparel Merchandising and Management, Cal Poly Pomona (2022)

title: Vamonos: A Zero-Risk, High-Reward Brand System
text: We partnered with Vamonos to build a launch model that minimized inventory risk while maximizing reward. This involved bold identity work, lean product drops, and a scalable ecommerce experience tailored for social conversion.

title: Vamonos: A Zero-Risk, High-Reward Brand System
text:
Overview
Vamonos approached us seeking a brand system that minimized risk while maximizing reward. Our solution delivered a bold identity that resonated with their target audience.

title: Vamonos: A Zero-Risk, High-Reward Brand System
text:
Our Approach

Built a scalable Shopify storefront.

Designed all launch graphics and email flows.

Created influencer-focused product drops.

title: Vamonos: A Zero-Risk, High-Reward Brand System
text:
Results

$15–18K average sales per drop

35% profit share model with influencer

3–4 week sellout rate with < $1k ad spend

← Back to Portfolio

title: The Hair Shop: Seamless Integration of PR & Retail Merchandise
text:
The Hair Shop needed an effortless, stylish product that could serve dual purposes:
– A marketing asset for PR campaigns
– An easy-to-sell in-store product

title: The Hair Shop: Seamless Integration of PR & Retail Merchandise
text:
Overview
This wasn’t just about making merch—it was about creating a product that enhances the brand’s marketing power while feeling essential to the customer.

title: The Hair Shop: Seamless Integration of PR & Retail Merchandise
text:
Our Approach

Versatile, Wearable Product Design – The end result? An easy-to-love item that felt premium but accessible, bridging the gap between brand identity and real-world usability.

Scalable for PR & Retail – Whether used in influencer marketing kits or sold in-store, the product seamlessly aligned with the brand’s aesthetic and customer expectations.

Strategic Merchandising Integration – Every element, from packaging to placement, was optimized to drive both brand awareness and revenue.

title: The Hair Shop: Seamless Integration of PR & Retail Merchandise
text:
Results

Dual-purpose merchandise for marketing & retail

Increased visibility through influencer campaigns

In-store product that felt organic, not promotional

← Back to Portfolio
